result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:29 AM Attorney Steven Hughes in court.   Defendant Andre L Green did not appear.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for jury status hearing in 22CF114.  
Defense has no indication of their clients whereabouts.
Based on defendant's non-appearance Court orders capias.  Court orders bail revoked and forfeited.
Court orders the jury trial removed from the Court's calendar.

Hearing on July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:58 AM Defendant Andre L Green in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.   Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests 22CF458 be set for jury trial.  
State advises they have received the alcohol panel on 22CF458 but are waiting for the drug panel.
State requests 22CF114 be set for jury trial instead.
Court will set 22CF114 for trial and have all other matters tag along for scheduling.  Jury trial expected to last one day.  Court will select an alternate juror.  Clerk to prepare a trial order.
State to file the alcohol panel results in 22CF458.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on June 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:58 AM Defendant Andre L Green in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Detective Thomas Casey, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Nesheim.
No cross examination by Defense
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.

The State recalls Detective Thomas Casey and testifies on redirect.
The Witness is excused.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.
